historySnippet.reasoning: A is already well above 0.75 and still rising, but D is collapsing (dD/dt=-0.007) so I’ll keep U at the proven-best 0.10 while reducing diversity loss via a small k_D_decay decrease (historically k_D_decay tweaks have improved A, e.g., Gen 687.1 and 906.0) to preserve long-run open-endedness without risking an A crash like the large drop at Gen 744.7.

A is already safely >0.75 but all derivatives are negative (C, D, A fading), so I’ll keep U at the proven-best 0.10 while stabilizing the slide by slightly reducing decay terms (avoiding big shifts given past large A drops when k_A_decay was perturbed too aggressively).

A is already above target but slightly fading while D is barely declining, so I’ll keep U at the proven best (0.10) and make a minimal stabilizing tweak by lowering k_A_decay a bit (history shows reducing k_A_decay strongly improved A at Gen 860.3) while easing diversity loss via a small k_D_decay reduction.

Agency is already safely above 0.75 but is slightly fading (dA/dt < 0); since past gains came from lowering k_A_decay (e.g., Gen 860.3) and current settings are close to the best record, make a small stabilizing tweak to k_A_decay while keeping U at the best-performing 0.10 to avoid destabilizing C/D.

Agency is already safely above 0.75 and still rising while Complexity is slightly decaying, so I’ll keep U at the best-record value (0.10) and slightly reduce k_C_decay to stabilize C without perturbing the proven A dynamics (history shows k_A_decay/k_D_decay tweaks can cause volatility).

A is already فوق 0.75 but is slightly fading while D is collapsing, so I’ll keep U near the best-record 0.10 and reduce diversity loss (k_D_decay) plus slightly boost diversity->complexity coupling (k_CD) to stabilize D without adding selection pressure; this is safer than a phase-shift given we’re near peak A and past small k_A_decay tweaks have been mixed.

Agency is already safely above 0.75 but is slightly fading (dA/dt<0) alongside decaying complexity (dC/dt<0), so we keep U at the proven best (0.10) and counter the drift by reducing decay terms (k_C_decay, k_A_decay) while slightly lowering k_D_decay to preserve high D that feeds C (noting past A gains from lowering k_C_decay at Gen 1213.2 and improving A via k_A_decay tuning around Gen 860.3).

Agency is already far above the 0.75 objective and still rising, but Diversity is actively collapsing (dD/dt=-0.0068) so I’ll keep U at the proven-best 0.10 while reducing k_D_decay toward the best-record setting to stabilize D without sacrificing A (history shows k_D_decay tweaks can move A and we want to avoid a future diversity crash).

A is already >0.75 but D is starting to collapse (dD/dt=-0.0022), so I’ll keep U at the best-record level while slightly reducing diversity decay to stabilize D and prevent future C/A erosion (consistent with earlier gains from tuning k_D_decay).

Agency is already safely above 0.75 and still rising, but Diversity is currently collapsing (dD/dt=-0.0058), so I’ll keep U at the best-record level while easing intrinsic diversity decay to stabilize D without sacrificing A (consistent with prior D-decay tweaks yielding gains).

name: Decay-Tuned Agency Weaver
description: This agent crossed the Agency Threshold by progressively tightening its internal loss terms—especially k_D_decay (0.02) and k_A_decay (0.001)—after repeated evolutionary edits showed agency gains whenever decay was reduced and instability when decay was mis-tuned. In a low-difficulty environment (U=0.10), it didn’t need aggressive adaptation to pressure; instead, it stabilized high Diversity (0.952) and strong Complexity (0.871) by balancing cross-coupling (k_CD=0.5, k_AC=0.49) with strong agency response to environment (k_AU=0.99), yielding a near-threshold emergence (A=0.995) that finally tipped past A>1.00 through decay optimization.
